Alcohol consumption is a **input factor**. It means that it is one of the inputs from the user to the model.

#### Alternative names:
* Alcohol
* Alcohol consumption
* Drinking

#### Uses

Alcohol consumption is used by the model in the following places

* [Breast cancer](/model/BreastCancer)
* [Colon cancer](/model/ColonCancer)
* [Esophagus cancer](/model/EatingTubeCancer)
* [Larynx Cancer](/model/LarynxCancer)
* [Liver cancer](/model/LiverCancer)
* [Mouth cancer](/model/MouthCancer)
* [Stomach cancer](/model/StomachCancer)
* [Chronic liver disease](/model/Chronic_Liver_Disease)
* [Coronary heart disease](/model/Ischemic)

#### Guidance

The user input is a typed number and should answer the question

> How much alcohol do you drink in a normal week?

The unit of the input is **Drinks**.

The answer has to be larger than 0 Drinks. The answer is recommended to be larger than 0 Drinks and smaller than 40 Drinks. A drink is defined as a US standard drink containing 14 grams of pure alcohol.


### Optimizability

[Optimizability](/model/optimizabilities) is a subjective measure used to describe how easy it is to optimize a certain factor of your life. The optimizability of Alcohol consumption is 5. This means that it can be interpreted as

> *It is possible to change, and it can be changed now or very soon.*
